JTAGBS

Python JTAG Boundary Scan library

Table of Contents

  • API
    • JTAGBS
    • JTAGCore

Quick search

API¶

This is where the documentation for the public API functions, and classes lives.

JTAGBS¶

class JTAGBS(interface)¶

JTAG Boundry Scan (JTAGBS) Top-Level Module - simply JTAG access to pins and stuff

get_device(device_index)¶

Return a Device() object of the given index, attached to this JTAG chain

init_scanchain()¶

Initialize the JTAG chain

list_available_probes()¶

Returns string list of detected probes, index of string used to select a probe

list_devices()¶

List info about each part

list_devids()¶

List detected device IDs

open_probe(probe)¶

Opens a probe by index or name - name will match partial list

scan()¶

Performs a scan, so updates register values

JTAGCore¶

class JTAGCore¶

Python interface for JTAG Boundary Scanner library.

This is a wrapper around the C DLL

bsdl_attach(filepath, device_number)¶

Attach a BSDL file to a given device on the chain

deinit()¶

Close connection - on some devices code will hang if you don’t call this

get_bsdl_id(filepath)¶

Find the device id in a BSDL file (useful to match files)

get_devid(device_number)¶

Get a given device ID in the chain

get_number_devices()¶

Get number of devices detected in the chain

get_number_of_pins(device_number)¶

Get total number of pins in device

get_pin_id(device_number, pinname)¶

Convert a pin name to a pin number/id

get_pin_properties(device_number, pinid)¶

Get pin name & type from numeric pin id

get_pin_state(device_number, pinid, pintype='input')¶

Get state of a pin register (normally input)

get_probe_names()¶

Get the name of returned probes

open_probe(probeid)¶

Try to open the given probe

scan(write_only=False)¶

Perform an update of the JTAG chain status, can do writeonly to ignore inputs

scan_init_chain()¶

Init the scan chain

set_debug_level(level)¶

Set level from 0 (verbose) to 4 (little)

set_pin_state(device, pinid, state, pintype)¶

Set or clear a bit in a given output register (output or oe)

set_scan_mode(device_number, mode)¶

Set scan mode to passive (sample) or active (extest)
